title: IT Specialist - SAP Finance (FI) & Controlling (CO) Modules
description:
Everyone at Olin contributes to our Winning Model. We empower our employees to make a difference at work, home and in their communities. We celebrate and reward our diverse and innovative workforce that defines our future and contributes through leadership, engagement and productivity.



Join our winning team as an **IT Specialist - SAP Finance (FI) & Controlling (CO) Modules** to be locatedat Olin's Corporate Headquarters in **Clayton, MO** (St. Louis area) or a **virtual** location in the United States. Additional locations may include **Charleston, TN or Houston (Katy), TX****.** This position is also eligible for a **hybrid** work schedule. This functional IT Specialist will be part of a team supporting ongoing operations and also includes the design and implementation of enhancements, support upgrades and might also require participation in projects through the entire System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).


**IT Specialist - SAP Finance (FI) & Controlling (CO) Modules Essential Job Functions:**


* Stays abreast of SAP releases and new functionality and makes related recommendations to internal business customers and IT management.
* Collaborates with internal business customers and other support team members, understanding global business process, plan and implement changes in production environment of SAP S4.
* Documents scope and requirements for enhancements, changes, and breakages
	+ Develops and documents detailed requirements.
	+ Performs required configuration changes.
	+ Documents and communicates needed programming changes.
	+ Performs initial testing of enhancements, changes, and break-fixes.
	+ Collaborates with internal business customers and other support team members to plan and execute user acceptance testing for new and modified processes and systems components.
* Ensures that issues are handled end-to-end in terms of integration with other SAP modules.
* Liaises with cross-functional project teams – across geographies, on a global scale.
* Ensures compliance with Change Control procedures for on-going changes, enhancements and projects and maintain operational procedures around supported environments.
* Maintains Document Repository for business and IT processes.

**IT Specialist - SAP Finance (FI) & Controlling (CO) Modules Minimum Requirements:**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* Bachelor's Degree\\* required; Information Technology, Computer Science or Accounting disciplines preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years' experience with SAP Finance module.
* Must be able to support all parts of the SAP FI/CO configuration including but not limited to:
	+ Accounts Receivable
	+ FSCM Credit/Collections/Disputes Management
	+ Product Costing.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
* Ability to work in team oriented, collaborative environment.
* Attention to detail, self-motivated and self-directed.
* Analytical and creative problem-solving skills.

**Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and/or experience:**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* Knowledge of the integration points with Sales and Distribution and/or Materials Management and/or Production Planning.
* Knowledge of electronic bank statements and/or integration with banks.
* Experience with supporting global operations with locations such as Brazil, Mexico, Europe, etc.
* Experience with SAP Analysis for Office.
* Knowledge of S/4 HANA suite of applications.
* Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud solutions (SAC, Datasphere, etc.).
* Experience working with outsourced AMS provider.
* Knowledge of SAP Solution Manager and ChaRM.
* Experience with third-party tax engines and SAP tax integration (OneSource, etc.).


**Grow your career where you are rewarded and valued.**

 **Who We Are**  

Since 1892, Olin Corporation has steadily grown to become the industry leader in both chemicals manufacturing and ammunition. The three divisions of Olin Corporation, Olin Chlor Alkali Products and Vinyls, Olin Epoxy and Winchester, employ approximately 8,000 global team members in more than 20 countries with customers in nearly 100 countries around the globe.

  



\\*Degree must be from a school that is accredited by an accrediting agency recognized by the Secretary of Education of the U.S. Department of Education or equivalent program from an international university.



Olin does not provide any form of sponsorship. We will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J or TN or who need sponsorship now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.


**Olin is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.**


*Employees can expect to be paid a salary of approximately $93,100 - $135,000. This salary is only an estimate and may vary based on an applicant’s location, market data/ranges, an applicant’s skills and prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications, and other relevant factors.*

title: Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair
description:
About Rivian:

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Role Summary:

As a Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair, you will support Rivian’s Certified Network repair strategy reporting directly to the Regional Collision Manager and supporting RCCN Account Managers. You will be responsible for ensuring great customer satisfaction at our Certified Network locations. This role will require the establishment of exacting standards of performance and operational excellence, as well as support of regional on-ground operations. The Regional Technical Support Specialist, will work in the field with 3rd Party Certified Partners, and travel throughout the region.  

This role will require exceptional cross functional interaction across multiple teams within Rivian as well as external 3rd party partners. A dynamic and resourceful team member with proven leadership qualities, great communications skills, an analytical approach to problem solving, continuous improvement, and organization. Responsible for the day-to-day operations in an OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) managed network of high performing 3rd party repair partners in a dynamic environment. This role will require extensive travel, operational excellence, organization and excel in internal and external communication skills – you will bridge the gap between the Rivian Certified Networks, the local Rivian Service Center, the Certified Network Operations Team, and Rivian vehicle owners. The Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair will report to the Sr. Manager, Certified Collision Network.
Responsibilities:
* Recruit, Onboard, and support 3rd party certified network programs with technical or operational needs
* Execute on deliverables, milestone reports, open action items, risks, and mitigation plans
* Drive quality, continuous improvement, and deliver on key performance indicators
* Collaborate alongside regional management to handle any challenges that arise during repairs of Rivian customer vehicles
* Ensure operational excellence and validate that brand standards are maintained in accordance with Rivian Certified Network Standards
* Drive success for the greater Certified Network by providing feedback to the Network Operations Team
* Collaborate with Network and Service Engineering Teams to address repair challenges and customer concerns
* Analyze the business, create, and communicate clear action plans that optimize results in collaboration with the Regional Manager


Qualifications:
* 5+ years of experience in automotive collision repair, OEM, and/or technical field, with emphasis in engineering, quality, service, operations, and supply chain
* Experience in supporting teams in an automotive or high-tech environment
* Must possess a valid driver’s license, with a clean driving record
* Experience managing multiple projects across varying geographic locations simultaneously
* The ability to effectively communicate with internal and external partners
* Thorough organization and attention to detail
* Ability to sit or stand for 8-10 hours per day
* Ability to lift 35 lbs.
* Occasionally required to climb, walk, stoop, kneel, or crouch
* Requires travel up to 75% of the time


Pay Disclosure:
**Salary Range for California Based Applicants**: $121,000 to $150,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for Colorado Based Applicants**: $114,000 to $132,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for New York Based Applicants**: $130,000 to $150,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for Washington State Based Applicants**: $121,000 to $139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Benefits Summary:** Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.
Company Statements:
#### **Equal Opportunity**


Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.#### **Candidate Data Privacy**


Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. **Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.**

title: Software Support Specialist
description:
**IN SUMMARY...**  

The Software Support Specialist supports Azalea's clients on our various software applications and serves as a liaison between our clients and the various departments of Azalea's staff to facilitate a smooth working relationship.

 **WHAT YOU WILL DO...**

* Provide continuous software support solutions to Azalea Health customers in a timely manner
* Interact with customers through multiple platforms Including: face-to-face interactions, web meetings, support ticket updates, and email/phone communications
* Maintain clear, concise documentation of all support matters
* Effectively document and record all aspects of client interactions in the designated client management systems to promote transparency and understanding of software issues
* Manage the help content and support ticketing system
* Assist in testing and implementing software upgrades, as well as any associated communication with the Software Development department
* Maintain current, relevant knowledge of Azalea's software products and services
* Partner with product teams, departments, and functional units to resolve software application issues
* Upsell current clients and occasionally conduct product demonstrations to potential clients

**BACKGROUND AND SKILLS YOU WILL BRING...**

* High School Diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree in Business, Communications, Operations or related field preferred
* Strong customer service and client relations acumen
* Prior experience in Healthcare or Healthcare IT preferred
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent computer skills with strong proficiency in web-based and SaaS applications
* Flexibility and adaptability; must be able to seamlessly pivot to meet objectives of physicians, practice administrators, and other executives

**SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE...**

* Being aggressive and taking initiative; we trust you to move the needle forward
* Doing the job; outcomes are just as important as strategy
* Being adaptable and amenable to meet the changes of a dynamic and evolving industry
* Demonstrating humility; partnership and collaboration is who we are and how we operate
* Tapping into your innovative side; conventional is not always correct

**HOW WE INVEST IN YOU...**

* Competitive and comprehensive benefits: Coverage options to support the whole person, including full medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
	+ Generous employer sponsored subsidy towards employee's medical insurance premiums
	+ Azalea Health covers 100% of the premiums for Life AD&D and Long-Term Disability for all eligible full-time employees
* Balance and flexibility: Simple Paid Time Off (PTO) options. You earn your time, use it as you choose.
* Economic opportunity: Competitive total rewards package that offers competitive pay and advancement opportunities

 **Azalea Health's EEO Statement**


Azalea Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce where our employees excel based on merit, qualifications, knowledge, ability, and job performance. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, veteran status, and any other characteristics protected by federal, state, and local laws that make our employees unique.

title: Network Operations Center Infrastructure Specialist
description:
**About Us:** We're frontline Managed Services, a forward-thinking MSP, and we're on the lookout for a dynamic individual to join us. If you are passionate about marketing, sales, and project management, we want you to be a part of our journey.

Are you passionate about maintaining and optimizing extensive network infrastructures, ensuring peak performance and security? Join our team as an NOC Specialist – Infrastructure Specialist, where you'll be a crucial player in our global efforts. You'll work collaboratively with continental and global NOC teams, contributing to the seamless operation of client networks.

**Position Overview:**

As a NOC Specialist – Infrastructure Specialist, you will be the escalation point for client queries, providing second-level service by addressing tickets on our ServiceNow platform. Join our 24x7 infrastructure surveillance team, delivering round-the-clock coverage for Managed Infrastructure Services to guarantee maximum service availability and performance. Your role extends to fault handling, maintaining hardware serial audits, and configuring bespoke graphing.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Network Monitoring and Maintenance:**
* Monitor and maintain large-scale networks using advanced platforms like SolarWinds and LogicMonitor.
* Implement firmware and Windows patching for enhanced network security and performance.
* **Collaboration and Troubleshooting:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve issues promptly.
* Utilize ServiceNow for incident tracking, resolution, and documentation.
* **Knowledgebase Management:**
* Actively contribute to and maintain the client knowledge base with technical documentation.
* **24x7 Support and Escalation:**
* Participate in a 24x7 shift and support call-out rota if required.
* Handle fault identification and escalation, liaising with 3rd party suppliers, leading escalation through to resolution.
* **Hardware Audits and Custom Configurations:**
* Maintain hardware serial audits.
* Write custom monitoring plugins and configure bespoke graphing.
* **Analysis and Skill Development:**
* Analyze client data and generate escalation reports.
* Actively participate in the skill development of colleagues through workshops and presentations.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* **Technical Proficiency:**
* Basic Linux CLI and sysadmin skills for Centos and Ubuntu preferred.
* Experience with Virtualization tools such as Hyper-V, VMware vSphere, and ESXi.
* Experience managing and configuring SNMP and JDBC.
* Familiarity with monitoring platforms like SolarWinds and LogicMonitor.
* **Networking and Security:**
* Hands-on experience with firmware and Windows patching.
* Knowledge of network topologies, standards, and infrastructure.
* Proven experience with Azure cloud platform services.
* **Communication and Collaboration:**
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Previous experience in a NOC environment, monitoring various network services.
* **Process Knowledge:**
* Familiarity with Event Management and Incident Management processes.
* **Team Skills:**
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* Commitment to diversity and inclusion.
* **Organizational Skills:**
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* **Tools and Systems:**
* Experience using trouble-ticketing and service management systems.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Support Specialist (Waunakee, WI / Kansas City MO / Remote (8407)
description:
For more than 135 years, DeLaval has been driving progress in milk production by innovating solutions for dairy producers around the globe. We are a team of passionate professionals committed to *making sustainable food production possible.* Working with our dealers across North America, we offer integrated solutions of milking systems, consumables and services to help dairy producers address challenges in animal welfare, food safety, farm profitability, and work efficiency.
At DeLaval, we prioritize our people and their safety. We pride ourselves on our culture of thinking and acting as *One DeLaval*. We also empower our people to *Make Things Happen*, and encourage *Setting Direction.*  


**CORE FUNCTION**
The Technical Support Specialist is responsible for providing technical-related support to our local market area and Dealer personnel within the USA. Maintain a strong customer focus on a daily basis across all channels including, phone, email, in person meetings, and on farm visits. Troubleshoot technical and software issues on dairy farms; including PLCs, computer networks, herd management software, robotic, and, industrial control systems.  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**
* Conduct technical assistance for robotic milking equipment on rotary milking platforms.
* Supporting DeLaval herd management software and related equipment; including farm networks.
* Manage support of new product installations and product updates.
* Provide technical, classroom-based training for field staff and dealer employees
* Be part of an on-call rotation to provide support.
* Other responsibilities as assigned

  


**REQUIRED SKILLS / COMPETENCIES**
* Strong customer focus, with a sense of urgency to resolve problems or issues
* Experience with troubleshooting electrical systems, VFDs, PLCs, and control systems.
* Knowledge of computer networking.
* Strong communicator
* Work cross-functionally; can function well as a member of a team
* Ability to manage large amounts of information
* 20% travel required- Remote based employees will travel more.

  


**EXPERIENCE / BACKGROUND**
* B.A./B.S. in Agricultural Equipment, Software Application and/or Engineering helpful but not required
* 2-4 years of experience working with dairy equipment is beneficial
* Understanding of dairy cow udder physiology and dairy milking systems helpful
* Proficiency in Spanish a plus.

  


#LI-REMOTE

title: Software Support Level 1
description:
DaySmart is a provider of business management software that specializes in providing scheduling and workflow solutions to businesses around the world. We provide award-winning business software to thousands of users in a variety of industries.


Love technology? Come join our technical support team! Fun place to work, great benefits and advanced technical training.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage chat and email conversations

* Field general use questions over the phone (occasionally via chat or email) about our software and additional services

* Assist in exporting existing customer data for our database conversion team and assist in importing the converted data into the customer’s software
* Upsell additional add-on services

**What We Expect to See:**

* Prior customer service experience
* Positive attitude
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Ability to adapt quickly

**What We Like to See:**

* Ability to work on Saturday
* Former Geek Squad or similar experience
* Eagerness to learn and grow
* Passion for helping others
* Passion for technology


DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran.

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

As an IT Support Specialist at Restaurant365, you will play a crucial role in providing front-line technical support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of our internal IT systems. The IT Support Specialist will work closely with end-users to resolve IT issues, optimize system performance, and ensure the security and reliability of the organization’s internal IT infrastructure.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ End-user Support: Provide technical assistance to end-users, both remotely and on-site, to address and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues.
+ Troubleshooting: Diagnose and troubleshoot hardware and software problems, including desktops, laptops, printers, and mobile devices. Resolve issues related to operating systems, applications, and network connectivity.
+ Hardware and Software Maintenance: Perform routine maintenance and updates on IT systems and equipment. Install, configure, and upgrade hardware and software as necessary.
+ Network Support: Assist with network-related tasks, including setting up and maintaining user accounts, resolving connectivity issues, and ensuring network security.
+ Security and Compliance: Maintain and enforce security protocols, ensuring data integrity, confidentiality, and compliance with relevant regulations. Implement and maintain backup and disaster recovery strategies.
+ Documentation: Keep detailed records on helpdesk tickets, troubleshooting steps, and solutions provided. Create and update documentation for IT processes and procedures as needed.
+ User Training: Provide training to end-users on IT systems, software applications, and best practices for data security during new hire orientation.

### **What you'll need to be successful in this role:**

+ Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, or an equally relevant field, or an equivalent combination of higher education and relevant work experience.
+ Industry certifications such as CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), or equivalent will be considered in lieu of a college degree.
+ 1+ year experience providing end-user technical support is required.
+ Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues of Windows PCs, Apple macOS devices, mobile devices, and A/V equipment efficiently.
+ Knowledge of corporate security guidelines, authorization procedures, and staff onboarding/offboarding operations.
+ Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications and administration is preferred, including user management, security configurations, and application deployment.
+ Familiarity with Microsoft Entra (Azure Active Directory) Administration.
+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively assist end-users and document technical procedures inside of internal helpdesk ticketing system.
+ A customer-centric mindset with the ability to patiently communicate technical concepts to non-technical individuals.
+ Understanding of enterprise MDM solutions such as Microsoft Intune and Jamf Pro.
+ Flexibility to work outside of regular business hours when necessary to accommodate urgent support requests.
+ Experience in any of the following systems are preferred: Freshservice, Slack, Atlassian, Monday.com, Torii, Mimecast.
+ Occasional travel may be required.

### **R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation**

+ This position has a salary range of $29.80-$40.86 per hour. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
+ 401k + matching
+ Equity Option Grant
+ Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
+ Wellness initiatives
  

#BI-Remote
$29.80 - $40.86 an hour
R365 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all forward-thinkers who embrace change and possess a positive attitude to apply.

title: Senior IT Support Specialist
description:
**\\*\\*100% Remote Opportunity\\*\\***
**Salary is dependent upon experience and certifications. All candidates must be able to successfully pass a background check.**
We are looking for an experienced **Senior IT Support Specialist** to join our team supporting our **IronOrbit** Workspaces clients. In our two + decades in business, we have built a sterling reputation not just on the quality of our services, but also a commitment to results. We take a proactive approach to IT, solving problems before they happen, saving you time and money while maximizing system uptime.
We’re looking for humble, ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you’re passionate about technology and people. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and understand the importance of customer service and driving technologies to their limits.
**Responsibilities:**
* Working alone or in tandem with other specialists to support large scale RDS/VDI solutions
* Provide remote support and resolution for complex technical issues, ensuring SME level understanding of our core offerings
* Also assist our managed care clients with general L2/L3 support and systems administration tasks for on-premise, remote, and cloud environments
* Identify and act quickly on opportunities to enhance customer experience
* Strong intellectual and service operations depth, coupled with effective executive presence and a communication style that conveys expertise and instills confidence
* Strong customer-centric mindset and ability to build and maintain strong, collaborative and effective relationships internally and externally
* Ensure that our applications are designed and implemented to the highest security standards thus maintaining and enhancing customer trust
**Minimum Experience:**
* 5+ years of experience in a Windows systems administrator role
* 3+ years of supporting private/public cloud environments: VMWare Horizon, Citrix, TS/RDS, or other VDI solutions
* 3+ years working with networking, including TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks. CCNA is a plus
* Solid experience using: Veeam, Office 365, GPOs, VOIP, MDM, Cisco, Sophos, and SonicWall firewalls.
* Intermediate knowledge of VMware and Hyper-V environments
* Strong knowledge of Windows Server
* Strong knowledge of Windows AD, DHCP and DNS
* Database experience, including knowledge of SQL
* Excellent communication and organizational skills, and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workplace
* Interest in Cloud Engineering and its impact on greater business practices
* Skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required

*IronOrbit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. IronOrbit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.*

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
**Work at Radformation**  

Cancer rates increase year after year, yet high-quality care is not universal. By automating and standardizing the treatment planning workflow, Radformation aims to create a system where any patient anywhere can receive the same high-quality care.  

We strive daily to reduce cancer's global impact and help save more of the 10 million lives it claims each year. Our unwavering commitment is to deliver reliable, high-quality, automated solutions that allow clinics to standardized care for every single person in need.  

We are looking for a highly motivated individual who has a passion for IT systems and problem-solving. The **IT Support Specialist** will help our Radformation internal teams setup and manage our hardware and software solutions, as well as troubleshoot technical issues that may arise. You will play a key role in maintaining Radformation’s internal infrastructure while also providing back up support to the customer-facing installation teams.
### **Primary Responsibilities**

* Order and keep inventory of equipment purchases
* Creating Accounts and Account Management across all platforms
* Work with staff members to setup new equipment during onboarding
* Maintain Remote Boxes for testing and development
* Assist team members in troubleshooting internal IT issues

### **Additional Responsibilities**

* Support the sales and success teams by installing and upgrading clinics
* Complete IT documents as requested by clinics
* Aid the clinical customer support representatives as needed

### **Abilities**

* Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and sharing them with the healthcare community
* Understanding of treatment planning and radiation oncology clinical workflow
* Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently
* Highly motivated to help clinicians improve their workflow
* Excellent communication skills to assist internal staff via phone and web meetings

### **Required Experience**

* 3+ years experience of clinical radiation oncology IT
* Experience with Aria OIS and Eclipse TPS
* Strong experience supporting clinical applications and their infrastructure: client/server/storage/network
* Strong critical thinking skills
* Positive attitude

### **Preferred Experience**

* Cybersecurity experience
* Customer service experience

  

Salary listed is in USD for US-based employees and will be commensurate with experience. Salary range will vary for international candidates and be commensurate with experience and geographical location.**What makes us so RAD?**  

We take care of our people!  

Radformation offers top-tier medical, dental, vision care for employees and their families. Each role comes with stock options\\*, our 401(k) & employer match vest immediately and you'll never have to stress about taking the time you need with self-managed PTO. We support our growing RAD families with generous parental leave, along with additional part-time work to help transition back into the swing of things. We are a fully remote team and while we may be apart, virtual events, yearly retreats and a collaborative work environment keep us close and connected. *Cancer transcends any individual differences we may have. That's why at Radformation we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.** *Stock options are offered to US-based employees only.*

title: Technical Sales Support Specialist (East)
description:
**Technical Sales Support Specialist (East)**
=============================================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

As Technical Sales Support Specialist, you will be the technical point person for the technical specifications and acceptance, commercial agreements, proposal development, technical channel management and resolve related, complex protection, control, and automation problems and Sales organization in Electrification Distribution System in Mebane, NC or Northeast US area, providing technical solutions and advice on ABB products, systems and applications.

### **This position reports to**


Sales Support Manager

### **Your responsibilities**

* Develop strong internal and external relationships with ABB field sales team, ABB channels, end customers and other ABB businesses field resources with special focus on end customer.
* Evaluate customer needs and develop & implement business strategies to achieve customer acceptance and adoption of ABB protection, control & automation portfolio, determining appropriate technical, marketing & contractual approach consistent the organization’s objectives.
* Grow distribution automation products and services double digits annually.
* Develop & execute action plans for targeted customers.
* Organize and lead project teams consisting of various support groups to respond effectively to unique business opportunities in the marketplace, determining commercial viability of products and resources required.
* Negotiate commercial features and arrangement with potential business partners, customers and internal businesses while effectively representing ABB, being sure to provide guidance and training to staff, channel, establish standards, manage, and document performance and develop associated recommendations.
* Develop 5-year strategic plan for the regional segment.
* Develop business relationships with customer executives, inform them of ABB’s technological developments and new products, assist them in solving complex problems, achieve cost savings and optimize their operations.
* Travel up to 50% as needed.

### **Your background**

* Bachelor of Science in Engineering / Business required. Advanced degree is preferred.
* 5-7 years of technical, application and marketing experience.
* Medium voltage protection and control relay or applications experience and experience with medium voltage power distribution system operation and equipment, with knowledge in protection & automation.
* A background in relay, switchgear, transformer, recloser and breaker technologies.
* Familiarity of the approval and procurement process of targeted customer segment is desired.
* Ability to analyze market and competitive trends and products and recommend action plans leading to new ABB sales.

### **Benefits**

* Retirement plan
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Healthcare plan
* Wellbeing program

### **More about us**


ABB's Distribution Solutions Division provides utility, industrial and commercial customers with safe, smart and sustainable technologies for the distribution of electricity. With ABB AbilityTM enabled digital solutions at its core, our extensive portfolio includes distribution automation products, switching, limiting, measuring and sensing devices, switchgear, modular substation packages, and related services. We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC\\_KnowYourRights\\_screen\\_reader\\_10\\_20.pdf https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/pdf/pay-transp\\_%20English\\_formattedESQA508c.pdf As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762. Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner. #LI-Remote

title: Software Presales Support Manager
description:
**Company Overview**
--------------------

**At Motorola Solutions, we’re guided by a shared purpose – helping people be their best in the moments that matter – and we’re living up to our purpose every day by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. We’re solving for safer - safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals, safer businesses – safer everywhere. We’re building integrated technologies that help protect people, property and places. We’re connecting public safety agencies and enterprises – enabling the collaboration that’s critical for a more proactive approach to safety and security. We’re committed to solving for safer every day because the work we do here matters.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


**Department Overview**
------------------------


The position is for a manager role for software presales support within the Software Enterprise organization. This individual and team will be responsible for all tools, templates, and training (both direct and channel) for all software solutions and sleeves that serve our public safety customers including Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions. Ownership of these processes and tools allows for a more consistent approach throughout software presales creating better alignment between all key work partners involved including sales, finance, deployment & a more consistent go to market approach for sales and our customers. Additionally, select strategic initiatives relating to proposal cycle time, quality, and the overall software integration story will be incorporated into daily workflows based on individual skill sets.
**Job Description**
--------------------


The primary job functions for this role include:

* The individual should be the expert in their technical sleeve so templates, tools, and training created allow anyone to learn and perform the needed presales tasks
* Own and Maintain Statement of Work(s) for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions
* Own and Maintain Sole Source Proposal Templates for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions
* Own and Maintain RFP Response Templates for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions
* Own and Maintain tools including configurators, quoting forms for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions, including the costing, part #'s, and pricing
* Own and Maintain the pre to post sales templates and process
* Understand the needs of our pricing & profitability and finance teams when developing new tools, configurators
* Coordinate and manage regularly scheduled progress meetings on new product introductions and understand where it fits within the technology’s scope
* Have a financial understanding of list price, costs, gross margin and how they are derived
* Listen to the Sales & Presale teams on what scenarios work well and what needs to be fine tuned
* Provide constructive feedback to sales & presale teams on positive/negative scenarios
* Provide training to presales, sales, and our channels around the presale process including tools, templates, and process
* Manage process questions from direct sales and software sales regarding legal, service, and financial questions to arrive at a "Best Effort Approach"
* Maintain Accurate Sales Questionnaire forms that drives the design of the opportunity for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions
* Assemble RACI matrix to then templatize the language to support SOW's for Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and all related Cloud solutions
* Work with Product and Launch Management on new offers and alterations to current offers
* Provide Pricing and CPQ teams with System Integration costing and quote output collateral
* Validate costs and language remain consistent across all Presales deliverables
* Organize contents into a well-formatted, cohesive documents for ease of maintenance
* Act as a general liaison between PreSales and Deployment teams as necessary
* Striker team to help wherever the organization needs it, Computer Aided Dispatch presales & the production of urgent Computer Aided Dispatch proposals, for example
* Motivated to drive, implement, and close select strategic initiatives relating to proposal cycle time, quality, and the overall software integration story that impact the SLT
* Act as a trusted advisor to presales and sales by influencing forward thinking capabilities to drive the creation and maintenance of quoting tools, proposal templates, and SOW’s


The ideal candidate has the following skills and capabilities:

* Bachelor’s Degree is required
* Ability to work within strict deadlines
* Strong multi-tasking, organizational, and time management skills
* Experience in Emergency Call Handling, Computer Aided Dispatch, and Cloud solutions in any capacity (Tool, Proposal, SOWs) a Plus
* Seeking 4+ years of experience in presales, sales, business development, finance, or related fields
* Prior working experience in Public Safety Software systems is highly desired
* A positive attitude with a can-do mentality that enables you to be creative, resourceful and deliver results
* Strong written and oral communications skills with the ability to present information to technical and non-technical audiences
* Ability to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders
* Willingness to think out of the box and challenge the status quo
* Attention to detail and a flawless execution mindset
* Proficiency in applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Google email and web applications
* Travel Required: 20%
* The base salary range for the position is $90,000-$130,000 USD.


#LI-CR1


#LI-REMOTE

**Basic Requirements**
----------------------

* Bachelor’s Degree
* 4+ years of experience in one of the following: presales, sales, business development, or finance

**Travel Requirements**
-----------------------


10-25%
**Relocation Provided**
------------------------


None
**Position Type**
------------------


Experienced
**Referral Payment Plan**
--------------------------


No**Our** **U.S. Benefits include:**

* Incentive Bonus Plans
* Medical, Dental, Vision benefits
* 401K with Company Match
* 9 Paid Holidays
* Generous Paid Time Off Packages
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan

* and more!

title: IT Support (Flex)
description:
### **Basics**


**Type:** Independent Contractor.  

**Schedule:** Flex-Time (10-20 hours/week).  

**Education:** Any.  

**Location:** Remote (in the European Union, and Italy in particular, are preferred).



Motu Novu seeks an IT Support Professional, preferably based in the European Union and especially in Italy, who can work remotely to provide IT assistance and support to the firm’s personnel and clients. Occasional international travel around the EU and to the USA may occur.


### **What You Do**


* Provide IT assistance and support to the firm’s personnel and clients.
* Respond to IT support request promptly based on the firm’s SLAs (internal or with clients).
* Assist users re: basic IT tools (e.g. office automation, email and calendar clients, document repository, ticket system, etc.)
* Provide remote assistance (e.g. Teamviewer) on windows systems and applications.
* Ensure that user systems are kept updated and upgraded.
* Monitor the status of various production systems.
* Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on linux-based servers.
* Report directly to Motu Novu’s Technology Manager.

### **What You Need**


* Confident and poised attitude in internal and external interactions.
* Good oral and written communications skills.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality.
* Proficiency with office productivity tools.
* Good knowledge of Windows and Linux.
* Reliable Internet connection.
* Preferred: Good knowledge of LAMP stack.
* Legally authorized to work in the European Union (i.e. EU Citizen, permanent resident, or valid work visa).
* Italian – European CEFR Level B1 or higher (required only for candidates based in Italy).
* English – European CEFR Level B2 or higher.
* VAT setup as an independent contractor.

### **What You Get**


* **Base Compensation:** $15-$30/hour, depending on qualifications and experience.
* **Benefits:** Performance bonus.
* Opportunity to work on a wide range of assignments.
* Opportunity to travel within Europe and to the USA.
* Opportunity to fully develop your career.
* If interested, opportunity to be relocated to the USA, with visa sponsorship, after at least 3 years of successful collaboration.

title: IT Helpdesk Remote Support; Support Specialist I
description:
The Support Specialist’s primary responsibilities are technical support and customer service. Support Specialists ensure end users can accomplish business and education tasks by helping them resolve technical issues. Support Specialists receive, prioritize, document, and ultimately resolve end user computer related help requests via Phone and Chat Queues. Problem resolution may involve the use of diagnostic and help request tracking tools, remote troubleshooting, and/or software installation. Support specialists coordinate with other IT departments to ensure that reported issues are being resolved. Must have home internet service to provide support while working from home. Must accomplish necessary certifications within required timeframe (MOS, IC3 Fundamentals, and others as required). This position requires 40 hours/week, performance of duties via home internet access, and includes weekend and evening shifts. The exact schedule will be determined based on current staffing needs. Office hours are 7AM – 12AM Monday – Friday. 10AM – 6PM Saturday, 1PM – 12AM Sunday.
  
**Essential Functions and Responsibilities**

1. Maintain call and support metrics at required level for assigned area.


2. Escalate tasks due to need for higher level of technical ability or customer service skills required.


3. Utilize help request system to document work and customer interaction.


**Qualifications, Credentials, and Competencies**

Minimum Qualifications:


1. A designated home workspace free of distractions.


2. A reliable high speed home Internet connection(10Mbps Download, 5Mbps Upload).


3. Familiarity with computer hardware, software, operations, and common problems.


4. Ability to learn new technologies and concepts quickly.


5. Strong customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.


6. Previous education or professional certifications may be considered in lieu of work experience.


Preferred Qualifications :


1. Two-year college degree, with a concentration in Computer Science or related discipline or equivalent work experience.


2. A minimum of one year of experience in computer troubleshooting or a similar technical field.


3. Familiarity with Liberty University’s IT systems, policies, and organization.


4. Microsoft Office Specialist certifications: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.

title: Technical Advisor (Ecosystem and Support Programs)
description:

Do you want to work for a company that cares about you as a person, not just a number? For a company that provides outstanding leadership? For a company that offers exceptional benefits? RER Solutions, Inc., could be your new home.


RER Solutions, Inc., is accepting resumes for a **Technical Advisor (Ecosystem and Supporting Programs)** to support **The Office of Clean Energy Demonstrations (OCED)’s** mission to deliver clean energy demonstration projects at scale in partnership with the private sector to accelerate deployment, market adoption, and the equitable transition to a decarbonized energy system. * Support monitoring and evaluating technology area project portfolios to ensure program and individual project performance goals are met

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Minimum of US Citizenship required to obtain client-issued Public Trust
* Technical expertise in clean energy technologies
* Experience with small businesses/start-ups/incubators/accelerators
* Experience in technology transfer and commercialization
* Project management experience
* Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and experience in conducting risk versus payoff assessments
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Excellent attention to detail and an understanding of fundamental business writing
